response.original_title: Hortulus Farm: Where History & Horticulture Meet
response.overview: Hortulus Farm is an 18th-century farmstead, public garden, and horticulture education center in Bucks County, Pennsylvania. The farm once functioned as a major dairy operation until the Great Depression. In 1980, famed garden and event designer Renny Reynolds and garden author Jack Staub restored the property with 24 exquisitely designed flower and vegetable gardens and a horticulture museum.
response.tagline: An 18th-century farmstead, garden, and horticulture center in Bucks County, PA.
response.title: Hortulus Farm: Where History & Horticulture Meet
